txt.en: Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
The Taming of the Mearas
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.

'Yes, I too am well-rested and ready for the day ahead! Until now, we have only briefly touched upon the mearas. I wish to explore the bond between the Rohirrim and horses. One could say that it started with the wanderings of the Ai-thúda. I would argue that it was the taming of the mearas that created the real bond that I and my people have with horses. Come, let us find this bond, together.'
'The mearas ever after allowed only the greatest lords of the Éothéod.'
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
'Let me tell you one of most important tales told in all of Rohan.'
Léothred can be found at Framsburg.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred at Framsburg.

'The Éothéod’s fortune drew unwanted attention from Orcs, who raided farm and village alike in force shortly after Cendric’s death.'
Léothred can be found at Framsburg.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred at Framsburg.
Éothéod
'Cendric’s son, Hárda, was past his prime as a warrior, and fell in battle only three years into his rule.'
Léothred can be found at Framsburg.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred at Framsburg.
'Hárda's son Léod, however, was much more formidable, and broke the Orcs in battle outside the gates of Framsburg.'

Hárda

Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
'I am well-rested and ready for the day ahead!'
'Léod sought to prove his worth as his forebears had done and tame one of the mearas.'
'That is the tale of how horse and rider became one.'
Léod
Léothred, the Rohirric scholar, seeks to learn more of his people history in Misthallow.

'The mearas ever after allowed only the greatest lords of the Éothéod and their sons and daughters to ride them. I believe there is one exception to this in all of history. Do you know of the horse, Shadowfax? Yes, the steed who has come to be companion to the Wizard Mithrandir. Shadowfax himself is a mearh.'

'Hailed as a hero by his people, Léod sought to prove his worth as his forebears had done and tame one of the mearas. Again, however, the attempt ended in disaster. Though he lasted longer than any before him, and the horse bore him far, it at last threw him and Léod's head struck a rock, killing him.'

'[placeholder], let me tell you one of most important tales told in all of Rohan about the history of my people. It is a story of a pivotal moment for us, about the son of Léod, a lad of sixteen, named Eorl....'

'And that is the tale of how horse and rider became one. It was the foundation of all of Rohan, laid right here!\n\n'Now, long ago, after the fall of Wilderland, Marhari the Proud had declared that no leader of his people would be called lord until the Éothéod had come to their proper home. The Wells had seemed so in the time of Gisilhári and the others that followed, but now the Éothéod needed more, and until they found it Eorl would remain simply Master Eorl.'
